14 // Should this be full virtual?
19 class Object {
20  public:
21  EIGEN_MAKE_ALIGNED_OPERATOR_NEW
22 
23  // A wall is an infinite plane.
24  enum Type { kSphere = 0, kCube, kPlane, kCylinder };
25 
26  Object(const Point& center, Type type)
27  : Object(center, type, Color::White()) {}
28  Object(const Point& center, Type type, const Color& color)
29  : center_(center), type_(type), color_(color) {}
30  virtual ~Object() {}
31 
33  virtual FloatingPoint getDistanceToPoint(const Point& point) const = 0;
34 
35  Color getColor() const { return color_; }
36 
38  virtual bool getRayIntersection(const Point& ray_origin,
39  const Point& ray_direction,
40  FloatingPoint max_dist,
41  Point* intersect_point,
42  FloatingPoint* intersect_dist) const = 0;
43 
44  protected:
45  Point center_;
46  Type type_;
47  Color color_;
48 };
49 
50 class Sphere : public Object {
51  public:
52  EIGEN_MAKE_ALIGNED_OPERATOR_NEW
53 
54  Sphere(const Point& center, FloatingPoint radius)
55  : Object(center, Type::kSphere), radius_(radius) {}
56  Sphere(const Point& center, FloatingPoint radius, const Color& color)
57  : Object(center, Type::kSphere, color), radius_(radius) {}
58 
59  virtual FloatingPoint getDistanceToPoint(const Point& point) const {
60  FloatingPoint distance = (center_ - point).norm() - radius_;
61  return distance;
62  }
63 
64  virtual bool getRayIntersection(const Point& ray_origin,
65  const Point& ray_direction,
66  FloatingPoint max_dist,
67  Point* intersect_point,
68  FloatingPoint* intersect_dist) const {
69  // From https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Line%E2%80%93sphere_intersection
70  // x = o + dl is the ray equation
71  // r = sphere radius, c = sphere center
72  FloatingPoint under_square_root =
73  pow(ray_direction.dot(ray_origin - center_), 2) -
74  (ray_origin - center_).squaredNorm() + pow(radius_, 2);
75 
76  // No real roots = no intersection.
77  if (under_square_root < 0.0) {
78  return false;
79  }
80 
81  FloatingPoint d =
82  -(ray_direction.dot(ray_origin - center_)) - sqrt(under_square_root);
83 
84  // Intersection behind the origin.
85  if (d < 0.0) {
86  return false;
87  }
88  // Intersection greater than max dist, so no intersection in the sensor
89  // range.
90  if (d > max_dist) {
91  return false;
92  }
93 
94  *intersect_point = ray_origin + d * ray_direction;
95  *intersect_dist = d;
96  return true;
97  }
98 
99  protected:
100  FloatingPoint radius_;
101 };
102 
103 class Cube : public Object {
104  public:
105  EIGEN_MAKE_ALIGNED_OPERATOR_NEW
106 
107  Cube(const Point& center, const Point& size)
108  : Object(center, Type::kCube), size_(size) {}
109  Cube(const Point& center, const Point& size, const Color& color)
110  : Object(center, Type::kCube, color), size_(size) {}
111 
112  virtual FloatingPoint getDistanceToPoint(const Point& point) const {
113  // Solution from http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5254838/
114  // calculating-distance-between-a-point-and-a-rectangular-box-nearest-point
115 
116  Point distance_vector = Point::Zero();
117  distance_vector.x() =
118  std::max(std::max(center_.x() - size_.x() / 2.0 - point.x(), 0.0),
119  point.x() - center_.x() - size_.x() / 2.0);
120  distance_vector.y() =
121  std::max(std::max(center_.y() - size_.y() / 2.0 - point.y(), 0.0),
122  point.y() - center_.y() - size_.y() / 2.0);
123  distance_vector.z() =
124  std::max(std::max(center_.z() - size_.z() / 2.0 - point.z(), 0.0),
125  point.z() - center_.z() - size_.z() / 2.0);
126 
127  FloatingPoint distance = distance_vector.norm();
128 
129  // Basically 0... Means it's inside!
130  if (distance < kEpsilon) {
131  distance_vector.x() = std::max(center_.x() - size_.x() / 2.0 - point.x(),
132  point.x() - center_.x() - size_.x() / 2.0);
133  distance_vector.y() = std::max(center_.y() - size_.y() / 2.0 - point.y(),
134  point.y() - center_.y() - size_.y() / 2.0);
135  distance_vector.z() = std::max(center_.z() - size_.z() / 2.0 - point.z(),
136  point.z() - center_.z() - size_.z() / 2.0);
137  distance = distance_vector.maxCoeff();
138  }
139 
140  return distance;
141  }
142 
143  virtual bool getRayIntersection(const Point& ray_origin,
144  const Point& ray_direction,
145  FloatingPoint max_dist,
146  Point* intersect_point,
147  FloatingPoint* intersect_dist) const {
148  // Adapted from https://www.scratchapixel.com/lessons/3d-basic-rendering/
149  // minimal-ray-tracer-rendering-simple-shapes/ray-box-intersection
150  // Compute min and max limits in 3D.
151 
152  // Precalculate signs and inverse directions.
153  Point inv_dir(1.0 / ray_direction.x(), 1.0 / ray_direction.y(),
154  1.0 / ray_direction.z());
155  Eigen::Vector3i ray_sign(inv_dir.x() < 0.0, inv_dir.y() < 0.0,
156  inv_dir.z() < 0.0);
157 
158  Point bounds[2];
159  bounds[0] = center_ - size_ / 2.0;
160  bounds[1] = center_ + size_ / 2.0;
161 
162  FloatingPoint tmin =
163  (bounds[ray_sign.x()].x() - ray_origin.x()) * inv_dir.x();
164  FloatingPoint tmax =
165  (bounds[1 - ray_sign.x()].x() - ray_origin.x()) * inv_dir.x();
166  FloatingPoint tymin =
167  (bounds[ray_sign.y()].y() - ray_origin.y()) * inv_dir.y();
168  FloatingPoint tymax =
169  (bounds[1 - ray_sign.y()].y() - ray_origin.y()) * inv_dir.y();
170 
171  if ((tmin > tymax) || (tymin > tmax)) return false;
172  if (tymin > tmin) tmin = tymin;
173  if (tymax < tmax) tmax = tymax;
174 
175  FloatingPoint tzmin =
176  (bounds[ray_sign.z()].z() - ray_origin.z()) * inv_dir.z();
177  FloatingPoint tzmax =
178  (bounds[1 - ray_sign.z()].z() - ray_origin.z()) * inv_dir.z();
179 
180  if ((tmin > tzmax) || (tzmin > tmax)) return false;
181  if (tzmin > tmin) tmin = tzmin;
182  if (tzmax < tmax) tmax = tzmax;
183 
184  FloatingPoint t = tmin;
185  if (t < 0.0) {
186  t = tmax;
187  if (t < 0.0) {
188  return false;
189  }
190  }
191 
192  if (t > max_dist) {
193  return false;
194  }
195 
196  *intersect_dist = t;
197  *intersect_point = ray_origin + ray_direction * t;
198 
199  return true;
200  }
201 
202  protected:
203  Point size_;
204 };
205 
207 class PlaneObject : public Object {
208  public:
209  EIGEN_MAKE_ALIGNED_OPERATOR_NEW
210 
211  PlaneObject(const Point& center, const Point& normal)
212  : Object(center, Type::kPlane), normal_(normal) {}
213  PlaneObject(const Point& center, const Point& normal, const Color& color)
214  : Object(center, Type::kPlane, color), normal_(normal) {
215  CHECK_NEAR(normal.norm(), 1.0, 1e-3);
216  }
217 
218  virtual FloatingPoint getDistanceToPoint(const Point& point) const {
219  // Compute the 'd' in ax + by + cz + d = 0:
220  // This is actually the scalar product I guess.
221  FloatingPoint d = -normal_.dot(center_);
222  FloatingPoint p = d / normal_.norm();
223 
224  FloatingPoint distance = normal_.dot(point) + p;
225  return distance;
226  }
227 
228  virtual bool getRayIntersection(const Point& ray_origin,
229  const Point& ray_direction,
230  FloatingPoint max_dist,
231  Point* intersect_point,
232  FloatingPoint* intersect_dist) const {
233  // From https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Line%E2%80%93plane_intersection
234  // Following notation of sphere more...
235  // x = o + dl is the ray equation
236  // n = normal, c = plane 'origin'
237  FloatingPoint denominator = ray_direction.dot(normal_);
238  if (std::abs(denominator) < kEpsilon) {
239  // Lines are parallel, no intersection.
240  return false;
241  }
242  FloatingPoint d = (center_ - ray_origin).dot(normal_) / denominator;
243  if (d < 0.0) {
244  return false;
245  }
246  if (d > max_dist) {
247  return false;
248  }
249  *intersect_point = ray_origin + d * ray_direction;
250  *intersect_dist = d;
251  return true;
252  }
253 
254  protected:
255  Point normal_;
256 };
257 
258 class Cylinder : public Object {
259  public:
260  EIGEN_MAKE_ALIGNED_OPERATOR_NEW
261 
262  Cylinder(const Point& center, FloatingPoint radius, FloatingPoint height)
263  : Object(center, Type::kCylinder), radius_(radius), height_(height) {}
264  Cylinder(const Point& center, FloatingPoint radius, FloatingPoint height,
265  const Color& color)
266  : Object(center, Type::kCylinder, color),
267  radius_(radius),
268  height_(height) {}
269 
270  virtual FloatingPoint getDistanceToPoint(const Point& point) const {
271  // From: https://math.stackexchange.com/questions/2064745/
272  // 3 cases, depending on z of point.
273  // First case: in plane with the cylinder. This also takes care of inside
274  // case.
275  FloatingPoint distance = 0.0;
276 
277  FloatingPoint min_z_limit = center_.z() - height_ / 2.0;
278  FloatingPoint max_z_limit = center_.z() + height_ / 2.0;
279  if (point.z() >= min_z_limit && point.z() <= max_z_limit) {
280  distance = (point.head<2>() - center_.head<2>()).norm() - radius_;
281  } else if (point.z() > max_z_limit) {
282  // Case 2: above the cylinder.
283  distance = std::sqrt(
284  std::max((point.head<2>() - center_.head<2>()).squaredNorm() -
285  radius_ * radius_,
286  static_cast<FloatingPoint>(0.0)) +
287  (point.z() - max_z_limit) * (point.z() - max_z_limit));
288  } else {
289  // Case 3: below cylinder.
290  distance = std::sqrt(
291  std::max((point.head<2>() - center_.head<2>()).squaredNorm() -
292  radius_ * radius_,
293  static_cast<FloatingPoint>(0.0)) +
294  (point.z() - min_z_limit) * (point.z() - min_z_limit));
295  }
296  return distance;
297  }
298 
299  virtual bool getRayIntersection(const Point& ray_origin,
300  const Point& ray_direction,
301  FloatingPoint max_dist,
302  Point* intersect_point,
303  FloatingPoint* intersect_dist) const {
304  // From http://woo4.me/wootracer/cylinder-intersection/
305  // and http://www.cl.cam.ac.uk/teaching/1999/AGraphHCI/SMAG/node2.html
306  // Define ray as P = E + tD, where E is ray_origin and D is ray_direction.
307  // We define our cylinder as centered in the xy coordinate system, so
308  // E in this case is actually ray_origin - center_.
309  Point vector_E = ray_origin - center_;
310  Point vector_D = ray_direction; // Axis aligned.
311 
312  FloatingPoint a = vector_D.x() * vector_D.x() + vector_D.y() * vector_D.y();
313  FloatingPoint b =
314  2 * vector_E.x() * vector_D.x() + 2 * vector_E.y() * vector_D.y();
315  FloatingPoint c = vector_E.x() * vector_E.x() +
316  vector_E.y() * vector_E.y() - radius_ * radius_;
317 
318  // t = (-b +- sqrt(b^2 - 4ac))/2a
319  // t only has solutions if b^2 - 4ac >= 0
320  FloatingPoint t1 = -1.0;
321  FloatingPoint t2 = -1.0;
322 
323  // Make sure we don't divide by 0.
324  if (std::abs(a) < kEpsilon) {
325  return false;
326  }
327 
328  FloatingPoint under_square_root = b * b - 4 * a * c;
329  if (under_square_root < 0) {
330  return false;
331  }
332  if (under_square_root <= kEpsilon) {
333  t1 = -b / (2 * a);
334  // Just keep t2 at invalid default value.
335  } else {
336  // 2 ts.
337  t1 = (-b + std::sqrt(under_square_root)) / (2 * a);
338  t2 = (-b - std::sqrt(under_square_root)) / (2 * a);
339  }
340 
341  // Great, now we got some ts, time to figure out whether we hit the cylinder
342  // or the endcaps.
343  FloatingPoint t = max_dist;
344 
345  FloatingPoint z1 = vector_E.z() + t1 * vector_D.z();
346  FloatingPoint z2 = vector_E.z() + t2 * vector_D.z();
347  bool t1_valid = t1 >= 0.0 && z1 >= -height_ / 2.0 && z1 <= height_ / 2.0;
348  bool t2_valid = t2 >= 0.0 && z2 >= -height_ / 2.0 && z2 <= height_ / 2.0;
349 
350  // Get the endcaps and their validity.
351  // Check end-cap intersections now... :(
352  FloatingPoint t3, t4;
353  bool t3_valid = false, t4_valid = false;
354 
355  // Make sure we don't divide by 0.
356  if (std::abs(vector_D.z()) > kEpsilon) {
357  // t3 is the bottom end-cap, t4 is the top.
358  t3 = (-height_ / 2.0 - vector_E.z()) / vector_D.z();
359  t4 = (height_ / 2.0 - vector_E.z()) / vector_D.z();
360 
361  Point q3 = vector_E + t3 * vector_D;
362  Point q4 = vector_E + t4 * vector_D;
363 
364  t3_valid = t3 >= 0.0 && q3.head<2>().norm() < radius_;
365  t4_valid = t4 >= 0.0 && q4.head<2>().norm() < radius_;
366  }
367 
368  if (!(t1_valid || t2_valid || t3_valid || t4_valid)) {
369  return false;
370  }
371  if (t1_valid) {
372  t = std::min(t, t1);
373  }
374  if (t2_valid) {
375  t = std::min(t, t2);
376  }
377  if (t3_valid) {
378  t = std::min(t, t3);
379  }
380  if (t4_valid) {
381  t = std::min(t, t4);
382  }
383 
384  // Intersection greater than max dist, so no intersection in the sensor
385  // range.
386  if (t >= max_dist) {
387  return false;
388  }
389 
390  // Back to normal coordinates now.
391  *intersect_point = ray_origin + t * ray_direction;
392  *intersect_dist = t;
393  return true;
394  }
395 
396  protected:
397  FloatingPoint radius_;
398  FloatingPoint height_;
399 };
400
